name: Help me build a strength based dual wielding Cleric/Monk/Fighter
author: yamuchaop

posts.author: yamuchaop
posts.content:
Hello people.

I found a bit of an oddity with the monk ability Flurry of blows.
Armor+Kama Kama+Kama Shield+Kama Unarmed+Armor Unarmed+Shield
Works Works Doesn't work Works Works
So my idea for using this is fairly straight forward, it allows me to be a dual-wielding strength based full plate wearing awesome dude. My initial idea is for a Cleric/Monk/Fighter.
The problem i am having is attributes. Ambidexterity requires 15 dexterity and is necessary for Improved two-weapon fighting.

So far the build looks like this:
Monk 1
Cleric 1-20
Fighter 1-6 (For weapon specialization and bonus feats!)
Cleric 21-32
Monk 2 (For tumble and discipline)

But the starting attributes is the problem, i picked human.
Strength 16 (+7 from levels, +7 from feats)
Dexterity 15 (For ambidexterity)
Constitution 10
Wisdom 16 (+3 from levels)
Intelligence 8
Charisma  8

This leaves my constitution and intelligence way too low. The build is also very rough around the edges at the moment.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
According to this page about Monks:
A monk's UBAB, armor class bonuses (from wisdom and every 5 levels), and speed are all negated when the monk wears armor other than clothing or uses a shield.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Why would you want to wear Heavy Armor when you could go Robes and use the Wisdom bonus to AC instead?

Then when your Cleric pops Divine Power it will use UBAB progression with Fighter AB and get the best of both worlds.

Or do you mean at lower levels?

You might want to change out Fighter for Ranger (gets dual wield feats for free, does not need the stat minimums).

Your build is also going to have experience loss.

I suppose you have a point. A full plate would effectively give 8 armor class where as with dex+wis i'd have at least 6 just from base stats. The reason i want to go Strength based is simply put damage, same reason for the fighter levels - 6 damage per attack starts to matter when you have 4 (BAB)+1 (Flurry)+1 (Haste)+2 (Dual)=8 attacks per round. Add a few more if using monk UBAB ;)

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, as long as the Heavy Armor is giving you more AC, then it would be wise to go with it.

But the AC bonus (assuming that Robes and Armor get the same bonuses) is 8.  If you have Dex and Wis bonus that is 8 or more, then there is no real reason to wear Heavy Armor (other than if one is worried about being flatfooted and loosing Dodge AC).

To that, of course, is the Attack progression.  It is much more advantageous to use Monk UBAB with Fighter AB than it is not to.  One will tend to hit more in a round than not.

I did not question going Strength - in fact, I made no reference to that.  I did make reference to Fighter, since you want to dual wield and are having questions about stats related to the dual wield feats.  One way around that is to go Ranger to pick up the dual wield feats without having to have the prereq stats for doing so.

If one plans to do the total ITWF feat compilation, then the Ranger is out as a class unless one is willing to take 9 levels of Ranger.  As that is "only" 3 levels more than your build takes in Fighter, I think that is relatively painless.  1 more Ranger level (10 total) will net you 2 FEs, with damage bonuses, respectively.

The reason I raised the Ranger at all was because you stated in your post that your Int and Con were way too low.  By going Ranger instead of Fighter, one would be able to go with reduced Dex and therefore increase both Int and Con, respectively without sacrificing ITWF.

Of course, this will also be dependent on not wearing anything more than medium armor - though if your Wis and Dex bonus is more than 7 combined, this is a non-issue.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: With several multiclass builds it is better to use full plate and shield, at least early on before the Dex, Wis and monk level based AC are high enough to compete with the AC of full plate.

posts.author: Sarthrovar
posts.content:
Where will you be playing this build? How important is playability versus level 40 power? In terms of not having enough INT or CON, are there specific skills you want? or a desired minimum amount of hit points? What are you using or planning for spell feats (magic or meta magic)? What about Devastating Critical?

I would recommend reading the Cleric guide that Maximillian Kane wrote : An Insight into the Cleric Class.
With only 19-20 Wisdom, changing the level spread to limit Cleric to somewhere between 20-26 levels and spending the extra levels elsewhere will give more flexibility. 24 levels are required for undispellable buffs (outside of Mord's). Also with a point buy system, keeping starting stat points at 14 or below will allow for a more optimal distribution. As an example, you need 15 DEX for Ambidexterity, but you don't need it at level 1; dropping starting DEX to 14 gives 2 stat points for CON or INT. Cleric has Great Wisdom as an epic bonus feat; Chamption of Torm also has Great Wisdom as epic bonus feat, which can be used to boost WIS to the desired level.

Picking 3 base classes will subject the build to XP penalties while leveling. Using a prestige class as the third class will avoid XP penalties while leveling, such as Blackguard or Champion of Torm.

Keeping with the original request of having a Cleric/Monk/Fighter, if you want Dev Crit and dual wield kamas you could change the level split to something like C 26 / M 2 / F 12
Devastating Critical is a heavy investment of feats: (Power Attack, Great Cleave, Improved Critical, Overwhelming Critical, and Devastating Critical).

Hope this helps or at least gives some ideas on how to tweak the original concept.
